name.value: FHIR Connectathon 17 - Versioned API - Specify Version - Ok Test Suite - JSON

description.value: Versioned API - Specify Version - Test suite using the JSON format where a Patient resource is read and the desired FHIR version is specified in the HTTP Accept header with the 'fhir-version=r4' content type parameter.
Enter a resource id for a valid Patient resource on the destination system.

Execute a FHIR read operation for a known Patient resource instance with the HTTP Accept FHIR JSON mime-type value and 'fhir-version=r4' content type parameter. The expected response code is 200 (OK) with a payload of the found Patient resource in a FHIR R4 version conformant JSON format.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type is present.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+json'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains 'charset=utf-8'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains 'fhir-version=r4'. Warning only to allow evaluation of remaining asserts.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
